title: eC-Tab2Text: Aspect-Based Text Generation from e-Commerce Product Tables
author: Luis Antonio Gutiérrez Guanilo (University of Engineering and Technology), Mir Tafseer Nayeem (University of Alberta), Cristian López (University of Engineering and Technology), Davood Rafiei (University of Alberta)
relevance_why: The fine-tuning of Large Language Models on structured e-commerce data fits within the broader context of using machine learning for data generation tasks relevant to audio research, particularly in improving data synthesis methods.
background: Generating natural language text from structured e-commerce product tables, specifically creating detailed reviews based on user queries about product features.
contribution: This paper introduces the eC-Tab2Text dataset to solve the problem of generating coherent product reviews from tables, achieving significant improvements in text generation metrics and contextual accuracy.
technical_comparison: Previous methods primarily target general-purpose datasets without domain-specific features. This work improves by using a specialized dataset that allows for detailed, aspect-based text generation tailored to products.
key_innovation: The introduction of a domain-specific dataset combined with fine-tuned language models enhances the contextual relevance and accuracy of generated reviews.
real_world_impact: Empowers e-commerce platforms to produce more useful and engaging product descriptions, potentially leading to improved customer satisfaction and sales. No immediate real-world impact.
limitations: The dataset is exclusively focused on mobile phone data, which may limit generalizability to other product categories.

new_terms.aspect-based text generation: **Aspect-based text generation** refers to the process of generating textual content focused on specific aspects or characteristics of an item, facilitating targeted information delivery.
new_terms.Large Language Models: **Large Language Models (LLMs)** are sophisticated algorithms designed to understand and generate human-like text, trained on vast datasets to perform various natural language processing tasks.

open_sourcing: The dataset and related resources are publicly available at [eC-Tab2Text](https://github.com/Luis-ntonio/eC-Tab2Text).
